intro: Cedronella triphylla, commonly known as the three-leafed cedron, is a perennial herb native to the Andean regions of South America. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which consist of three heart-shaped leaflets arranged symmetrically. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters during the spring and summer seasons. Its aromatic foliage contains essential oils, making it a valued plant in traditional herbal medicine. Cedronella triphylla thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial to full sunlight.
